titlestmt.titleproper: Hyde Park, Boston, Mass. First Congregational Church of Hyde Park records, 1860-2003. RG4923
titlestmt.author: Graham Cousins

did.unittitle: Hyde Park, Boston, Mass. First Congregational Church of Hyde Park records, 1860-2003.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: First Congregational Church (Hyde Park, Boston, Mass.)

did.abstract: The First Church of Hyde Park was established in 1860, incorporated in 1895, and closed in 2009. The original church building was constructed in 1865. Rev. George Owen gave the first sermon in the new church building in 1911 and new stained glass windows were added in 1917. This collection contains administrative records, membership information, photographs and scrapbooks, and church group records from 1860-2003 with the bulk of the records created between 1860-1930.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Hyde Park, Boston, Mass. First Congregational Church of Hyde Park records, 1860-2003., RG4923. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by First Congregational Church of Hyde Park in April 2009; no accession number.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Originally processed in 2012. Re-processed by Graham Cousins, August 2025, using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In June 1857 the first religious meetings were held in the village of Hyde Park and a Sabbath School was started. The first Congregational service in Hyde Park was held in December, in Bragg's Hall and led by Rev. L.R. Eastman. On May 7, 1863, an Ecclesiastical Council met to a organize a Congregational Church and a new church of 10 members was established and named the Hyde Park Congregational Church.

A gift of land was secured from the Real Estate and Building Company in 1865. The church operated as a Church and Society from 1866-1895 when it became incorporated. The original church building was erected in 1868.

Reverend Perley B. Davis was installed as the first pastor of Hyde Park Congregational church in 1867 and remained in the position until 1892. He was proceeded by Reverends Andrew W. Archibald, Henry N. Hoyt, and Lucius F. Reed between 1893-1910. Rev. George W. Owen served as reverend from 1911-1948 and oversaw the church during its largest period of growth and change as it moved into a newly erected church building at the start of his appointment.

The new auditorium seated 520 on the floor and 170 on the balcony. An organ was gifted to the new church by Mr. Edward E. Taylor of Boston in honor of his mother. The new church building had plain glass windows upon its construction. George Owen chose the theme of the evolution of Christianity for new stained-glass windows which were created by Charles J. Connick and installed in 1917. In November 1915 the old church building was sold.
The church continued operating through the 20th century. Due to declining membership the church closed in 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the First Congregational Church of Hyde Park from its inception in 1860 until 2003. Records include administrative records, meeting minutes, financial records, correspondence, bulletins and event programs, building records including blueprints, membership records and materials, photographs and scrapbooks.

The bulk of administrative records and correspondence were created between 1860-1930. The membership records cover the church's entire time frame. Researchers interested in the church's membership should devote time to the membership cards in boxes 13-16.

There is a largely complete collection of church bulletins from 1888-1976. Also of particular note are the scrapbooks and photographs for those interested in the visual history of the church and its impact on its community as represented from newspaper clippings. The Annals of the First Congregational Church of Hyde Park by William Lewis, 1860-1949, contain a detailed sketch of the church's history during the period for which most of the records in this collection pertain.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this collection have been arranged into five series by the subject of the records they contain: Administration, Services and fellowship, membership and vital statistics, church groups, and photographs and scrapbooks These series are then then further broken down into subseries by topics and then secondarily by chronology. Series 1 has 6 subseries representing administrative topics, Series 2 has 6 subseries divided by topics related to the services and personnel of the church, Series 3 has 6 subseries divided by the type of membership record, Series 4 has 13 subseries representing each of the church groups, and Series 5 contains 2 subseries divided by type of material.
Subseries 3: Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor, 1884-1909
Subseries 4: Junior Society of Christian Endeavor, 1889-1902
Subseries 5: Auxiliary to the Woman's Board, 1872-1939
Subseries 6: Junior Auxiliary to the Woman's Board, 1894-1903

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: First Congregational Church of Hyde Park. 100th Anniversary of the First Congregational Church. Hyde Park, Massachusetts, 1963. 17.11.1 H99.9F

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and historical records for the church from its inception until 1999. The most complete records fall between the 1880s-1920s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains administrative records including meeting minutes, reports, ballots, and notices. It also includes documents relating to the founding of the church and its adminsitration like the church manual, by-laws, and the incorporation document. Finally, it includes a historical overview of the church, and a report from the committee on individual cups.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Items were removed from this volume and placed in folder titled Financial records 1869-1891 (B2/F3) for preservation purposes.

did.unittitle: Annals of the First Congregational Church of Hyde Park by William Lewis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains financial reports and finance related correspondence from throughout the church's history. It also contains records created by and concerning the treasurer of the church and financial appeals sent to the church's members.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Materials in this folder were removed from Society Records and Meeting Minutes, 1879-1895 (B2/V3) for preservation purposes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains annual reports from a variety of commitees to be presented to the membership at the annual meeting. The majority of the records in this subseries are from the executive and prudential committees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Prudential committee which contains correspondence, reports, and meeting minutes regarding the activities of the committee including overseeing the building and its operations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the supply committe which was tasked with finding new ministers for the church. The records in this series include correspondence, meeting minutes, and materials about the various ministerial candidates.

did.unittitle: Supply committee records on Reverend Andrew Archibald
Supply committee records on Reverend Henry Hoyt
Supply committee records on Reverend Henry Hoyt record book
Supply committee record book on Lucius F. Reed
Supply committee records on Lucius F. Reed
Supply committee records on Reverend Henry Hoyt record book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the executive committee including reports, correspondence, meeting minutes, and collected record books pertaining to the activities of the committee especially in regards to chuch administration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the church's programming, sermons, and people including correspondence, reports, programs, bulletins, and sermons. It contains a very extensive collection of weekly bulletins from 1888-1976 as well as special event bulletins and programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains church correspondence to and between members of the church, its committees, and the general public.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains invitations and correspondence to and from the ecclesiastical council.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to events held by and at the church as well as conferences in which the church participated. The majority of this subsseries is made up of event programs. It also includes correspondence and other written materials pertaining to the events.

did.unittitle: Men's and women's group programs and events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains an extensive collection of weekly church bulletins. Most of the bulletins are contained in boudnd volumes though there is a small number of folders containing unbound bulletins. The bulletin collections are largely complete between the years 1888-1903 and 1915-1976 with only a small number of bulletins from the intervening years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to ministers and their sermons. It includes the record book and correspondence of George Owen. Correpsondence from and to the ministers of the church, a notebook on the event programming of Perley B. Davis's 25th ordination anniversary, and a small number of printed sermons given or collected by ministers of the church.

did.unittitle: Perley B. Davis 25th ordination anniversary notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the discipline of two members of the church, Charles Vaugn and Amos F. Bartlett. Records include correspondence and reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains membership and church statistical records. This includes member lists, addmission and dismission paperwork from and to the church, records of baptisms, weddings, and funerals, and an extensive collection of individual membership cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains admission forms to the church membership and a list of admitted members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains forms and records of dismissal both from Hyde Park and from other churches for members seeking admission to Hyde Park.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records about church members. This includes biographies written by the church about individual members, correspondence from members to the church, and obitiuaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains boxes of individual membership cards. These membership cards are seperated by membership at the time of the church's closing and members who left the church prior to that point.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains baptism, wedding, and funeral records from the church's founding through to its closure.

did.unittitle: Baptisms not recorded in roll book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains lists and ledger books of members througout the church's history. It also includes a list of servicemen connected to the church though it is unclear if this record is from the first or second world war.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains additional materials related to church membership. This includes manuals for new members and publicity aimed at generating new members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of and pertaining to various church groups throughout the church's history. These records are largely administrative in nature and the series contains many bound volumes of such records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records created by and pertaining to the sunday school. This includes bound superintendant's record books, teacher administration materials, correspondence, and programs. The historical sketch from 1911 may be of particular interest to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Heart and Hand Society. It is contained in a single bound volume of treasurer records.

did.unittitle: Heart and Hand society treasurer book
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists for records from the Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor. These records are largely contained within bound volumes of financial records and meeting minutes. It also contains some unbound materials including by-laws, correspondence and the group's consitution.

did.unittitle: Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors Membership
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors membership
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors list of members
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors Lookout committee
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors finance and executive
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors by-laws, constitution, and programs
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavors Lookout committee
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of records from the Junior Society of Christian Endeavor. These include financial records and meeting minutes all contained within bound volumes.

did.unittitle: Junior Society of Christian Endeavor record book
Junior Society of Christian Endeavor record book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the Auxiliary to the Woman's Board. These records are largely financial and meeting minutes contained in bound volumes. There are also two folders of unbound records including event programs and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Auxiliary to the Woman's Board record book
Junior Auxiliary to the Woman's Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of records of the Junior Auxiliary to the Woman's Board. These records include financial records, meeting minutes, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Junior Auxiliary to the Woman's Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Woman's Home Missionary Union. These administrative records are contained in 4 bound volumes and one folder of unbound materials and include financial records, correspondence, and meeting minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains three bound volumes of records from the Maternal association. These records are administrative in nature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Social Committee. It is contained in a single bound volume of administrative records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains three bound volumes of administrative records and one unbound folder of correspondence, financial records, and meeting minutes from the Church Aid Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records pertaining to the building and the activities of the New Church Building committee. These records include financial records, correspondence, meeting minutes and reports, technical diagrams and blueprints, and appraisals.

did.unittitle: New Church Building committee record book
New Church Building committee record book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative records from the Committee on Military Affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains the records of the Woman's Union. It is contained in a single bound volume of administrative records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains a folder of meeting minutes from the Fairmont circle in 1951.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs and scrapbooks. The photographs largely document the building at various times throughout its history. There are a number of scrapbooks of the photographs as well as a copy of the photograph scrapbook on CD. There is also a scrapbook of newspaper clippings related to the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of scrapbooks of photographs and newspaper clippings. The photograph scrapbooks largely document the church building.

phystech.head: Physical restrictions
phystech.p: The condition of this unbound volume is extremely fragile. Staff assistance required for access.

container.label: Mixed Materials

container.altrender: Extra Large Box with Detachable Lid
container.label: Mixed Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of unbound photographs. There are also two CD copies of the photograph scrapbook. The photographs document and the building and a few people with connections to the church.

did.unittitle: Photograph of Paul Poon Tai Ming
